newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia cuts April crude palm oil export tax.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia cuts April crude palm oil export tax.

text.p: Indonesia cut its export tax on crude palm oil to $41.08 a tonne in April from $52.52 in March, the Finance Ministry said on Thursday.
The tax on palm olein was reduced to $54.60 a tonne in April from $65.10 in March, while that on RBD palm oil was lowered to $43.68 in April from $55.64.
The tax on crude olein was reduced to $58.10 a tonne in April from $63.70 in March.

The export taxes, introduced in September 1994, are based on a composite average of international prices in the last two weeks of the previous month and are aimed at ensuring sufficient supply and stable prices in the domestic market.
